page.title: 05Footpaths in Sebergham
page.content: This area is well served with foot- paths though many are little or rarely used. Some of these rights of way are bridlepaths which are used by persons riding horses - for pleasure or exercise (of the horse). The most used footpath which is also a bridlepath starts at Sebergham Bridge and follows the Western bank of the River Caldew for approx. two kilometres through Dentonside Wood before leaving the river where the bank is too steep. The path continues at a higher level through some recently fenced parkland and through Parsons Park, a forest, and so to Caldbeck. This path forms part of what is known as the Cumbrian Way and is used by tourists on hiking holidays. Dub Mill Spout flows out of an un- derground system into the River Caldew near this path.
